title: China’s debt-saddled regions owe far more than they can pay back without Beijing’s help
description: Figures show the extent that fiscal losses have had in some Chinese provinces and municipalities as investments have slumped and revenue wanes, while questions remain about Beijing’s debt-swap plan.

title: US ‘confident’ of Joe Biden-Xi Jinping meeting next month on Apec sidelines
description: Foreign Minister Wang Yi’s visit to Washington lays the groundwork for the two leaders to meet in San Francisco.

title: Ron DeSantis says China creates conflict by propping up Russia and Iran
description: The 2024 US presidential hopeful linked Beijing to the Ukraine and Israel-Gaza wars, and called the Asian superpower a ‘formidable threat’ to the US.

title: Li Keqiang: former premier had fatal heart attack during swim in Shanghai, sources say
description: Two sources say Li – whose body has been flown to Beijing – had previously had coronary artery bypass surgery.

title: China and US hold first financial group meeting, will ‘deepen economic relationship’, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen says
description: Financial group meeting on Wednesday followed the first Economic Working Group meeting on Tuesday, with US Secretary of the Treasury Janet Yellen saying the US and China ‘have had a set of very constructive and deepening discussions’.

title: Li Keqiang: decades of diligence on China’s economic front lines
description: The late premier began his career in the Communist Party with a stint working in the countryside.

title: Could traditional Chinese medicine hold a key to treating life-threatening cardiac disease?
description: Clinical trial of Tongxinluo shows promising results in reducing serious heart attacks.

title: Li Keqiang: China’s charismatic, truth-telling former premier mourned, as deep reforms and ‘Likonomics’ hang in the air
description: Li Keqiang, who pushed for the private economy, foreign investment and simplified government procedures during his 10 years as premier, died in Shanghai on Friday morning at the age of 68.

title: Shanghai opens data economy industrial park in pilot free-trade zone Lingang amid China’s AI push
description: The International Data Economy Industrial Park aims to attract more than 100 leading data companies with a combined output of over 100 billion yuan by 2025.

title: China vows closer Iran ties on multilateral forums in first meeting since latest Israel-Gaza war
description: Gaza tragedies ‘have increased the instability of the Middle East’, Fars quotes Chinese Premier Li Qiang as telling Iranian First Vice-President Mohammad Mokhber on SCO margins in Bishkek.

title: US-China relations: 3 things a Xi-Biden summit should aim to achieve
description: Despite the dismal state of bilateral ties, a Xi-Biden summit should aim to agree on some realistic deliverables, underscore aspirational goals, and lay the foundations for a new institutional framework for engagement.

title: Beijing, Asean to start on third reading of South China Sea code of conduct
description: China and regional bloc will ‘accelerate negotiations’, Chinese foreign ministry says after senior officials had ‘in-depth exchange of views’ and agreed to deepen cooperation.

title: Video: Humanitarian crisis unfolding in Gaza as food supplies run out after total Israeli blockade
Video: Malaysia’s leader condemns Israel over Gaza strikes as thousands attend pro-Palestinian rally
Video: Asia’s Muslim-majority countries rally in support of Palestinians as Middle East conflict mounts
Li Keqiang: Chinese and foreign admirers share condolences, grief and memories of warm, capable former premier
description: Foreign diplomats, business leaders and China watchers around the world joined the Chinese public in mourning former premier who died on Friday.

title: Huawei, SMIC chip advances cannot be stopped by ‘futile’ US sanctions, says TSMC and semiconductor veteran
description: Burn J. Lin, a well-regarded former vice-president at TSMC, said SMIC should be able to advance to making 5-nm chips with existing equipment.

title: Zhang Ziyi’s divorce, China sacks Li Shangfu, John Lee’s policy ‘buffet’: SCMP’s 7 highlights of the week
description: From Zhang Ziyi announcing divorce to John Lee’s public policy ‘buffet’, here are a few highlights from SCMP’s recent reporting.

title: Chinese tourists seek less trodden path as overseas travellers decline, become choosier post-Covid
description: Chinese tourists hit 40.3 million in the first half of 2023, down from 155 million in all of 2019, but those who travel are seen to ‘prioritise personalised travel services catering to specific interests and passions’.

title: China, Pakistan to hold Arabian Sea joint military drills in November
description: Exercises to focus on ‘jointly responding to maritime security threats’, the Chinese defence ministry said.

title: Li Keqiang, former premier of China, is dead
description: State media is reporting that the former leader passed away in Shanghai on Thursday.

title: China’s population crisis reflects diminished public trust in government, academics say
description: At a public symposium on China’s demographic challenges, economists and policy researchers offer candid assessments of what the nation has truly lost as births plummet.

title: Two out of three Greater Bay Area firms have adopted sustainable practices, with ESG investments set to reach US$128 billion in next two years: survey
description: Two thirds of firms in the economic hub have adopted sustainable development practices in their business operations, and investments relating to ESG by such enterprises could reach HK$1 trillion (US$127.8 billion) in the next two years, according to a report by the Hong Kong Trade Development Council (HKTDC) and UOB.
